name: onionforge
description: A secure, educational .onion web platform demonstrating legitimate Tor usage for students, educators, and privacy enthusiasts.

scripts.status:detailed: docker compose ps --services | xargs -I {} sh -c 'echo "=== {} ===" && docker compose exec {} hostname'
scripts.onion:address: docker compose exec tor-service cat /var/lib/tor/hidden_service/hostname 2>/dev/null || echo '‚ö†Ô∏è  Tor service not running or address not generated yet'
scripts.onion:backup: tar -czf "tor-backup-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S).tar.gz" -C ./tor-data . 2>/dev/null && echo "‚úÖ Tor keys backed up to tor-backup-*.tar.gz" || echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  No tor-data directory found or backup failed"
scripts.onion:restore: test -f "$1" && tar -xzf "$1" -C ./tor-data && echo "‚úÖ Tor keys restored from $1" || echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Usage: npm run onion:restore <backup-file.tar.gz>"
scripts.clean: npm run stop:clean && docker system prune -f --volumes && echo "‚úÖ Docker system cleaned"
scripts.clean:all: npm run stop:all && docker system prune -a -f --volumes && rm -rf node_modules && echo "‚úÖ Everything cleaned"
scripts.update:nginx: docker pull nginx:alpine && docker-compose build nginx-web --no-cache
scripts.update:tor: docker pull alpine:latest && docker-compose build tor-service --no-cache
scripts.lint: npm run lint:html && npm run lint:css && npm run lint:js
scripts.lint:html: echo "üìÑ Linting HTML files..." && find src -name "*.html" -exec htmlhint {} \; && echo "‚úÖ HTML linting passed"
scripts.lint:css: echo "üé® Linting CSS files..." && find src -name "*.css" -exec stylelint {} \; && echo "‚úÖ CSS linting passed"
scripts.lint:js: echo "üìú Linting JavaScript files..." && find src -name "*.js" -exec eslint {} \; && echo "‚úÖ JavaScript linting passed"
scripts.lint:docker: echo "üê≥ Linting Docker files..." && docker run --rm -i hadolint/hadolint < docker/nginx/Dockerfile && docker run --rm -i hadolint/hadolint < docker/tor/Dockerfile && echo "‚úÖ Docker linting passed"
scripts.format: npm run format:html && npm run format:css && npm run format:js
scripts.audit:docker: trivy image --severity HIGH,CRITICAL $(docker images onionforge-* --format '{{.Repository}}:{{.Tag}}') 2>/dev/null || echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Install trivy for Docker image scanning"
scripts.audit:files: find src -type f -name "*.js" -exec grep -l "eval\|Function\|innerHTML" {} \; | xargs -I {} sh -c 'echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Potential security issue in: {}"'
scripts.docs: echo "üìö Opening documentation..." && open README.md 2>/dev/null || xdg-open README.md 2>/dev/null || echo "‚ö†Ô∏è  Could not open documentation"
scripts.help: echo "Available commands:\n" && npm run --silent | grep -E "^  \w" | sed 's/^  //' | sort
scripts.release: npm run test && npm run lint && npm run build && echo "‚úÖ Ready for release!"
scripts.postinstall: echo "üöÄ OnionForge installed! Run 'npm start' to launch your .onion site."
scripts.test: npm run test:unit && npm run test:integration && npm run test:e2e
scripts.test:unit: echo '‚ö†Ô∏è  Unit tests not yet implemented'
scripts.test:docker: docker compose up -d && sleep 10 && npm run test:integration && npm run test:e2e && docker compose down
